page.title: 16The Miner's Strike (Cont)
page.content: to end the long, devastating pit strike. After hours of talks the{end of the pit strike was announced. Most miners returned to work the following Tuesday. Even now that the pit strike had finished the miners who had stayed out treated the{scabs}as if they weren't there, never speaking to them and sometimes refusing to work with them. After the pit strike the pit closures were announced. Many people realised that{Arthur Scargill}was right in calling a national strike. The pits had lost many millions of pounds worth of coal because of the pit strike. The miners lost because not all the miners were on strike and there was plenty of coal to be moved around. On top of this oil was used to replace coal. {Stuart Rowe (Aged 13)
